hanzi-su-wiki:
劇

Значения

Резкий, сильный; драма, пьеса

Мнемоника

Битва тигра 虎 и кабана 豕, так увлеченных борьбой, что можно заколоть их простым ножом 刂. В переносном смысле — захватывающее театральное зрелище, безопасное для зрителей.

Варианты

剧

jù

(Simplified: 剧)
Pictophonetic: 豦 indicates the sound; 刂 (knife) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples: 劇本 [ jù běn ]: script for play, opera, movie etc; screenplay; scenario
purpleculture_tree:

heisig_chinese_memo: A great Indian drama acted out every year is how a poor Bengali boy fended off the tigers from his pigs using only a saber.
heisig_constituent: drama, tiger, sow, pig, sword, sabre, saber
koohiiStory1: There would be a lot of drama if a tiger tried to eat a sow but then the sow attacked it with a saber.
koohiiStory2: A great Indian drama acted out every year is how a poor Bengali boy fended off the tigers from his pigs using only a sabre.
jp_example_words:
喜劇(きげき): comedy, funny show
劇団(げきだん): troupe, theatrical company
演劇(えんげき): theatre play
劇(げき): performance, play
劇場(げきじょう): theatre
悲劇(ひげき): tragedy
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A tiger kills a pig with a knife in this new drama about the animal kingdom! The tiger and pig used to be friends when they were younger, but now they're bitter enemies and the tiger just stabbed the pig right in the chest with a knife.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture this scene from the drama as dramatically as you can. The pig stares into the tiger's eyes, "Tiger, you wouldn't–uh!" The pig's eyes slowly lower to see the knife sticking into its gut, the tiger's hand still holding it. "This is what you get, you pig," the tiger spits back, twisting.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: This drama is being put on by Gecki (げき), your childhood pet gecko. Gecki is playing all the parts, because as true drama fans know, one-gecko-shows are the highest form of art.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture Gecki acting out the part of the tiger and the pig in this drama. It's so intense, you're moved to tears. Bravo Gecki, bravo!
Ru_Radicals: 刈 (косить), 匕 (ложка), 卜 (гадание), 厂 (скала), 虍 (тигр), 豕 (свинья)

Kanshudo_mnemonic: fighting (豦) with swords (刂) would be dramatic
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Where the saber resides' is a new Chinese drama in which two families fight over a sword.

Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 豦 indicates the sound; 刂 (knife) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 豦 [ jù ] wild boar; to fight
    • 刂 [ dāo ] knife
①厲害，猛烈，迅速：劇變。劇痛。劇烈。劇毒。加劇。
②文藝的一種形式，作家把一定的主題編出來，利用舞臺由演員化裝演出：戲劇。劇本。劇情。劇種。劇院。劇壇。京劇。話劇。
③姓氏。

劇字的基本解释

劇
jù
见“剧”。

劇字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jù］
［《廣韻》奇逆切，入陌，羣。］
“勮1”的今字。“剧1”的繁体字。
(1)繁多；繁忙。
(2)指繁重的职务。
(3)艰难。
(4)巨，大。
(5)极，甚。
(6)急促；疾速。
(7)激烈；猛烈。
(8)交通要冲。
(9)游戏，嬉闹。
(10)杂戏；戏剧。
(11)犹折，断。
(12)阉割。
(13)古地名。
(14)姓。战国赵有剧辛。见《战国策·燕策一》。

劇字的康熙字典解释

【子集下】【刀字部】　劇； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页144第34
【唐韻】奇逆切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】竭㦸切，?音屐。【玉篇】甚也。【廣韻】增也，艱也。【王粲·詠史詩】人生各有志，終不爲此移。同知薶身劇，心亦有所施。【註】言三良殉秦穆，皆知死禍甚烈，不得不爲人用也。又戲也。【唐·杜牧·西江懷古詩】魏帝縫囊眞戲劇。又姓。【史記·游俠傳】雒陽有劇孟。又縣名。【集韻】在北海。

劇字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
劇字的起名意思

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［jù］
["Guangyun" odd inverse cut, enter the mo, group. ]
The present word for "勮1". Traditional characters for "剧1".
(1) Many; busy.
(2) Refers to heavy duty.
(3) Difficulty.
(4) Giant, big.
(5) Extremely, extremely.
(6) Hurry; fast.
(7) Fierce; fierce.
(8) Traffic critical points.
(9) Games and frolics.
(10) Miscellaneous drama; drama.
(11) Still broken and broken.
(12) Castration.
(13) Ancient place names.
(14) Last name. The Warring States Period Zhao Youju Xin. See "Warring States Policy·Yance One".

Name meaning

jù
вм. 剧
Radicals: 虍, 豕, 刂  (tiger, pig, knife)
Meaning Mnemonic
A tiger kills a pig with a knife in this new drama about the animal kingdom! The tiger and pig used to be friends when they were younger, but now they're bitter enemies and the tiger just stabbed the pig right in the chest with a knife.
Picture this scene from the drama as dramatically as you can. The pig stares into the tiger's eyes, "Tiger, you wouldn't–uh!" The pig's eyes slowly lower to see the knife sticking into its gut, the tiger's hand still holding it. "This is what you get, you pig," the tiger spits back, twisting.
Reading Mnemonic
This drama is being put on by Gecki (げき), your childhood pet gecko. Gecki is playing all the parts, because as true drama fans know, one-gecko-shows are the highest form of art.
Picture Gecki acting out the part of the tiger and the pig in this drama. It's so intense, you're moved to tears. Bravo Gecki, bravo!
